intro: Amerimnon assamicum, commonly known as the Assam bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as forests and mountainous areas. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer seasons. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
